intro: Euonymus verrucocarpus, commonly known as the rough-seeded box-elder, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Cistaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, rough-textured fruits. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are usually hairy on the underside. It produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters, followed by woody, three-lobed fruits. Euonymus verrucocarpus is often found in moist, shaded environments and can be a valuable component of forest understories.
